roles.name: Water Treatment Operator
roles.description: Operates and maintains water treatment facilities, ensuring safe drinking water supply by monitoring filtration, disinfection, and chemical dosing.

meta.typicalBackground: Technical diploma or on-the-job training in water treatment, knowledge of local water regulations
keyTools: SCADA for flow control, water quality testing equipment, pumps/valves monitoring
challenges: Seasonal water source changes, chemical supply management, dealing with emerging contaminants

sampleUseCase.scenario: When heavy rainfall increases turbidity, the operator adjusts coagulant dosing, preventing water turbidity from exceeding regulatory limits.

roles.name: Power Distribution Technician
roles.description: Maintains and repairs electrical distribution networks, responding to outages and ensuring service continuity for customers.

meta.typicalBackground: Electrical engineering or technician certification, safety training for live line work
keyTools: Line trucks, insulated tools, fault detection meters, GIS-based outage management software
challenges: Weather-related damage, risk of electrocution, complex scheduling for line upgrades

sampleUseCase.scenario: A technician locates a blown transformer caused by a lightning strike, replaces it overnight, and restores power to hundreds of households.

roles.name: Utility Planner
roles.description: Forecasts future utility demand, plans new infrastructure, and schedules upgrades to accommodate growing or shifting consumption patterns.

meta.typicalBackground: Engineering or urban planning, data analytics for consumption modeling, financial acumen for project feasibility
challenges: Population growth, environmental impact analyses, balancing short-term vs. long-term capacity needs

sampleUseCase.scenario: A planner predicts rising residential electricity use from new housing developments and proposes adding a substation plus feeder lines, preventing future overloads.

roles.name: Meter Reader / Smart Meter Technician
roles.description: Installs, maintains, and reads utility meters (electric, water, gas). With smart meters, handles remote data collection and troubleshooting.

meta.typicalBackground: Basic electrical or utility training, attention to detail, ability to interface with digital systems
keyTools: Handheld meter reading devices, remote metering software, personal protective equipment
challenges: Access to customer premises, device malfunctions, ensuring accurate billing data transmissions

sampleUseCase.scenario: A technician upgrades older mechanical meters to smart meters in a suburban neighborhood, enabling real-time consumption tracking and automated billing.

roles.name: Regulatory Affairs Specialist
roles.description: Ensures compliance with utility regulations, manages stakeholder relationships, and prepares rate cases or policy documentation.

meta.typicalBackground: Legal or public policy background, strong knowledge of utility codes, communication with government agencies
challenges: Negotiating rate increases, consumer advocacy pressures, rapidly evolving environmental standards

sampleUseCase.scenario: A specialist files a cost-of-service rate case with the public utilities commission, presenting evidence for moderate rate hikes to finance grid resilience upgrades.
